title: Retinol
summary: Retinol, also called vitamin A1, is a vitamin  in the vitamin A family[1] found in food and used as a dietary supplement.[2] As a supplement it is used to treat and prevent vitamin A deficiency, especially that which results in xerophthalmia.[1] In regions where deficiency is common, a single large dose is recommended to those at high risk twice a year.[3] It is also used to reduce the risk of complications in measles patients.[3] It is taken by mouth or by injection into a muscle.[1]
